description: Wunderlist was a cloud-based task management application. It allows users to manage their tasks from a smartphone, tablet, computer and smartwatch. Wunderlist was free; additional collaboration features were available in a paid version known as Wunderlist Pro (released April 2013). Wunderlist was created in 2011 by Berlin-based startup 6Wunderkinder. It was aquired by Microsoft in June 2015, at which time the app had over 13 million users. In April 2017, Microsoft announced that Wunderlist will eventually be discontinued in favor of To-Do, a new multi-platform app developed by the Wunderlist team that has direct integration with the company's Office 365 service.
name: Wunderlist

description: Microsoft Reader was an app to read PDF, XPS and TIFF files by Microsoft. It was killed in favour of Edge's implementation of PDF reading ability.
name: Microsoft Reader

description: Microsoft Silverlight was an application framework for writing and running rich Internet applications, similar to Adobe Flash.
name: Microsoft Silverlight

description: Windows Phone was a family of mobile operating systems developed by Microsoft for smartphones.
name: Windows Phone

description: Zune was a line of portable media players.
name: Zune Portable Media Player

description: Zune Marketplace was an online store that offered music, podcasts, TV shows, movies, music videos, and mobile applications.
name: Zune Marketplace

description: Zune Software was a media management software for Microsoft Windows, used to sync with all devices with Zune functionality.
name: Zune Software

description: Microsoft XNA was a freeware set of tools with a managed runtime environment provided by Microsoft that facilitates video game development and management, based on the .NET Framework, with versions that run on Windows NT, Windows Phone and the Xbox 360.
name: Microsoft XNA
